H0.text: The sugar reacts and colors the water when colored sugar is added to water.

H1.text: The sugar becomes white and the water changes color when colored sugar is added to water.

H2.text: The sugar evaporates and the water changes color when colored sugar is added to water.

H3.text: The sugar dissolves and colors the water when colored sugar is added to water.

A4.text: After water is evaporated by boiling the syrup under a vacuum, the syrup is cooled and seeded with sugar crystals.

A5.text: The sugar syrup is concentrated by boiling and then cooled and seeded with sugar crystals, causing the sugar to crystallize out.
